quest_title: The number of coulombs required to reduce 12.3 \(\textit{g}\) of nitrobenzene to aniline
explanation_txt:
\(C_{6} H_{5} NO_{2} +6H^{+} +6e^{-} \to \)\(C_{6} H_{5} NH_{2} +2H_{2} O\)

1 mole = 123 \(\textit{gm}\) nitrobenzene requires 6 mole electron \(\textit{e}\) \(=6\times 96500\; coulomb\) charge

\({\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu} \) 12.3 \(\textit{gm}\) nitrobenzene will require \(=\cfrac{6\times 96500\times 12.3}{123} \)\(=6\times 9650\; =57900\; C.\)

explanation_txt:
coefficients of \( t_r, t_{r+1},t_{r+2} \) are \( C(14,r-1) , C(14,r) \) and \( C(14,r+1) \).

Option (a) gives the coefficients as \( C(14,5), C(14,6), C(14,7) = 2002, 3003, 3432 \)

Option (b) gives the coefficients as \( C(14,6), C(14,7), C(14,8) = 3003, 3432, 3003 \)

Option (c) gives the coefficients as \( C(14,7), C(14,8), C(14,9) = 3432, 3003, 2002 \)

Option (d) gives the coefficients as \( C(14,8), C(14,9), C(14,10) = 3003, 2002, 1001 \)

Clearly, option (d) is correct.

quest_title: The systematic name of \(C H _ { 3 } - C H B r - C H _ { 2 } O H\) is
explanation_txt:
Here we have 2 functional groups i.e halogen and alcohol

And alcohol has higher order of preference. So numbering can be done as

\( \overset{3}C H _ { 3 } - \overset{2}C H B r - \overset{1}C H _ { 2 } O H\)

So correct name is \(2-bromopropan-1-ol\)

quest_title: Two balls are thrown horizontally from the top of a tower in opposite direction with velocities 3m/s and 4m/s then distance between them when their velocities are mutually perpendicular to each other is
explanation_txt:
\(\vec{V_1} . \vec{V_2}\)

\(\begin{array}{l}{\left(\mathrm{u}_{1} \hat{\mathrm{i}}-\mathrm{g} \mathrm{t} \hat{\mathrm{j}}\right) \cdot\left(-\mathrm{u}_{2} \hat{\mathrm{i}}-\mathrm{g} \mathrm{t} \hat{\mathrm{j}}\right)=0} \\ {-\mathrm{u}_{1} \mathrm{u}_{2}+\mathrm{g}^{2} \mathrm{t}^{2}=0} \\ {\mathrm{t}=\cfrac{\sqrt{\mathrm{u}_{1} \mathrm{u}_{2}}}{\mathrm{g}}=\cfrac{\sqrt{3 \times 4}}{10}=0.34 \mathrm{s}} \\ {\mathrm{S}=\left(\mathrm{u}_{1}+\mathrm{u}_{2}\right) \mathrm{t}=(3+4) \times 0.34=2.34 \mathrm{m}}\end{array}\)

quest_title: An object is moving in a circle of radius 100 m with a constant speed of 31.4 m/s. What is its average speed for one complete revolution?
explanation_txt: As the speed is constant throughout the circular motion therefore its average speed is equal to instantaneous speed.

quest_title: The apparent change in weight of a mass in bringing from pole of earth to equator is 0.4N. The apparent change in weight of mass is taken from pole to a place of latitude of 45\({}^{0}\) is
explanation_txt:
\(\Delta \mathrm{mg}=\mathrm{mR} \omega^{2}=0.4 \mathrm{N}\)

Again, \(\Delta m g^{\prime}=m g-m g\left(1-\cfrac{R \omega^{2}}{g} \cdot \cos ^{2} 45^{0}\right)\)

\(\qquad=\mathrm{mR} \omega^{2} 1 / 2=\cfrac{0.4}{2}=0.2 \mathrm{N}\)

quest_title: A spherical body with a radius 12cm radiates 450w power at 500k. If radius were halved and temperature doubled the power will be

quest_title: When light rays are incident on a prism at an angle of 45\(\mathrm{{}^\circ}\), the minimum deviation is obtained. If refractive index of the material of prism is \(\sqrt{2} \), then the angle of prism will be
explanation_txt:
Refractive index of prism in relation with minimum deviation is given as

\(\cfrac{\sin \cfrac{A+\delta \, m}{2} }{\sin \cfrac{A}{2} } =\mu\)

But \(\cfrac{A+\delta _{m} }{2} =i=45^{o} \) \([A+\delta=i+e,\) for minimum deviation \(i=e]\)

So \(\cfrac{\sin 45^{o} }{\sin (A/2)} =\sqrt{2} \Rightarrow \cfrac{1}{2} =\sin \cfrac{A}{2} \Rightarrow A=60^{o} \)

quest_title: Light wave enters from medium 1 to medium 2. Its velocity in 2\({}^{nd}\) medium is double from 1\({}^{st}\). For total internal reflection the angle of incidence must be greater than
explanation_txt: \(\cfrac{\mu _{2} }{\mu _{1} } =\cfrac{v_{1} }{v_{2} } =\cfrac{1}{2} \Rightarrow \cfrac{\mu _{1} }{\mu _{2} } =2(\mu _{1} >\mu _{2} )\) For total internal reflection \({}_{2} \mu _{1} =\cfrac{1}{\sin C} \Rightarrow \cfrac{\mu _{1} }{\mu _{2} } \) \[=\cfrac{1}{\sin C} \Rightarrow 2=\cfrac{1}{\sin C} \Rightarrow C=30^{o} \] So, for total (Internal reflection angle of incidence must be greater than 30\(\mathrm{{}^\circ}\).
question_plain_title: Light wave enters from medium 1 to medium 2. Its velocity in 2 medium is double from 1. For total internal reflection the angle of incidence must be greater than
explanation_plain_text: For total internal reflection So, for total (Internal reflection angle of incidence must be greater than 30.

quest_title:
What is the equivalent weight of iron in the reaction?  
 \(2 \mathrm{FeSO}_{4}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}+^{\prime} \mathrm{O}^{\prime}=\mathrm{Fe}_{2}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{3}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\) 
 [At. Wt. of Fe \(=55.8]\)
explanation_txt:
Iron is oxdised from +2 state to +3 state

Change in ON = 1

Equivalent weight = Molecuar weight / Change in ON = 55.8/1 = 55.8
question_plain_title: What is the equivalent weight of iron in the reaction? [At. Wt. of Fe
explanation_plain_text:
Iron is oxdised from +2 state to +3 state

Change in ON = 1

Equivalent weight = Molecuar weight / Change in ON = 55.8/1 = 55.8

quest_title: In a meter bridge experiment null point is obtained at 20cm from one end of the wire when resistance x is balanced against another resistance Y. If X\(\mathrm{<}\)Y then where will be the new position of null point from the same end. If one decides to balance a resistance of 4X against Y?
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{x}{Y}=\cfrac{l}{100-l}=\cfrac{20}{80}=\cfrac{X}{Y}=\cfrac{1}{4}\)

\(\cfrac{4 X}{Y}=\cfrac{l_{1}}{100-l_{1}} \Rightarrow 4 \cdot \cfrac{1}{4}=\cfrac{l_{1}}{100-l_{1}}\)

\(\therefore l_{1}=50 \mathrm{cm}\)

quest_title: If the coil of a moving coil of a moving coil galvanometer having 50 turns and resistance of 10 \(\Omega\) is removed and replaced by coil having 100 turns and resistance 50 \(\Omega\). Calculate the factor by which current sensitivity changes.
explanation_txt:
\(\text { Current sensitivity }\left(\cfrac{Q}{I}\right)=\cfrac{N A B}{C} \)
i.e. Current sensitivity \(\propto N \)
\(\cfrac{\text { (Current sensitivity) }_{2}}{\text { (Current sensitivity) }_{1}}=\cfrac{N_{2}}{N_{1}}=\cfrac{100}{50}=2\)
question_plain_title: If the coil of a moving coil of a moving coil galvanometer having 50 turns and resistance of 10 is removed and replaced by coil having 100 turns and resistance 50 . Calculate the factor by which current sensitivity changes.

quest_title: The molecular mass of chloride, MCl, is 74.5. The equivalent mass of the metal M will be
explanation_txt:
Mass of metal present in MCl = 74.5 - 35.5 = 39

35.5 g of chlorie combines with 39 gm of metal.

Hence, Equivalent mass of metal = 39
question_plain_title: The molecular mass of chloride, MCl, is 74.5. The equivalent mass of the metal M will be
explanation_plain_text:
Mass of metal present in MCl = 74.5 - 35.5 = 39

35.5 g of chlorie combines with 39 gm of metal.

Hence, Equivalent mass of metal = 39

quest_title: If there are two shared pairs and two lone pairs of electrons around the central atom in a covalent molecule, the shape of the molecule is

explanation_txt:

But since \( \cos \left( e ^ { x } \right) \leq 1 \)

So, there does not exist any solution.

quest_title: Two trains "A' and "B" approaches a stationary observer from opposite sides with speeds 10m/sec and 20m/sec. If both blow horns of frequency 1000Hz and the speed of sound in air is 330m/sec, the no. of beats heard by observe will be
explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} \mathrm{f}_{1} &=\left(\cfrac{v}{v-v_{\mathrm{s}_{1}}}\right) \times \mathrm{f}=\left(\cfrac{330}{330-10}\right) \times 1000 \\ &=1031.25=1031 \mathrm{Hz} \\ \mathrm{f}_{2} &=\left(\cfrac{v}{v-v_{s_{2}}}\right) \times \mathrm{f}=\left(\cfrac{330}{330-20}\right) \times 1000 \\ &=1064.51=1064 \mathrm{Hz} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: With the increase in atomic weights, melting points of the alkali metals
explanation_txt:
The melting point of alkali metals decreases down the group.

It is due to a decrease in charge density because shielding effect becomes more significant. So the electrons of outer shells are further away from the metal cations.

It leads to weaker electrostatic force of attraction which means it requires less energy to break down, causing a decrease in melting point.

Element Li Na K Rb Cs
M. Pt (in K) 453.5 370.8 336.2 312 301.5

quest_title: The largest possible set of real numbers which can be the domain of \( f ( x ) = \sqrt { 1 - \cfrac { 1 } { x } } \) is
explanation_txt:
\( 1 - \cfrac{1}{x} > 0 \Rightarrow \cfrac{1}{x} (x-1) > 0 \dots (i) \)

Of course, \( x \ne 0 \)

For \( x >0 \), (i) is true if \( x >1 \)

And for \(x < 0 \), (i) is true too.

So domain is \( (-\infty, 0 ) \cup (1, \infty) \)

quest_title: In a \(\Delta ABC,\) if \[\cfrac{b+c}{11} =\cfrac{c+a}{12} =\cfrac{a+b}{13} \], then \(\cos C=\)
explanation_txt:
\[\cfrac{b+c}{11} =\cfrac{c+a}{12} =\cfrac{a+b}{13} =\lambda \, \, \, ({\rm Let)}\]

\(b+c=11\lambda \) (i)

\(c+a=12\lambda \) (ii)

\(a+b=13\lambda \) (iii)

From (i) + (ii) + (iii),

\( 2(a + b + c) = 36 \lambda \)

\({\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu} a+b+c=18\lambda \) (iv)

Now, (iv) - (i) gives, \(a=7\lambda \)

(iv) - (ii) gives, \(b=6\lambda \)

(iv) - (iii) gives, \(c=5\lambda \)

Now,

\[\cos C=\cfrac{a^{2} +b^{2} -c^{2} }{2ab} =\cfrac{(7\lambda )^{2} +(6\lambda )^{2} -(5\lambda )^{2} }{2\times (7\lambda )\times (6\lambda )} \]

\[=\cfrac{49\lambda ^{2} +36\lambda ^{2} -25\lambda ^{2} }{84\lambda ^{2} } =\cfrac{60\lambda ^{2} }{84\lambda ^{2} } =\cfrac{5}{7} .\]

quest_title: The area enclosed by \( y = x^2+3x \) and the \(X\) axis is:
explanation_txt:
The curve cuts \(X\) axis at \( (-3,0),(0,0) \).

So the area is area under the curve \( y = x^2+3x\) above \(x\) axis, between \(x=-3\) and \(x=0 \).

Thus, \( A = \int_{-3}^{0} (x^2+3x)dx = \left[ \cfrac{x^3}{3} + 3\cfrac{x^2}{2} \right]_{-3}^{0} = -9/2 = -4.5 \)

But as area is non-negative, \(A = 4.5 \)

quest_title: Two ends of a train moving with a constant acceleration pass a certain point with velocities \(u\) and \(v\). The velocity with which the middle point of the train passes the same point is
explanation_txt:
\(v^{2}=\mathrm{u}^{2}+2 \mathrm{a} \times l \)
or \(, \cfrac{v^{2}-\mathrm{u}^{2}}{2 \mathrm{a}}=l \)

For middle point,

\(v_{1}^{2}=\mathrm{u}^{2}+2 \mathrm{a} \times \cfrac{l}{2} \)
or, \(v_{1}^{2}=\mathrm{u}^{2}+\mathrm{a} \times\left(\cfrac{v^{2}-\mathrm{u}^{2}}{2 \mathrm{a}}\right) \)
or, \(v_{1}^{2}=\cfrac{2 \mathrm{u}^{2}+v^{2}-\mathrm{u}^{2}}{2} \)
or, \(v_{1}^{2}=\cfrac{v^{2}+\mathrm{u}^{2}}{2} \)

\(\therefore v_{1}=\sqrt{\cfrac{\mathrm{v}^{2}+\mathrm{u}^{2}}{2}}\)

quest_title: A 100 g ball is coming towards a bat with a velocity of 10 m/s. It strikes on the bat at 60\(^{\circ}\) and rebounds. If the ball remains in contact with bat for 0.1 sec then average force is
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)\(F\) = \( \cfrac{mv \cos\theta + mv \cos\theta }{t} \)

\(\quad\)\( \) = \( \cfrac{mv}{t} \) \(\times \) 2cos\(\theta \)

\(\quad\)\( \) = \( \cfrac{100 \times 10^{-3} \times 10 \times 2 \times \cos 60^{\circ} }{0.1} \)= 10 N
question_plain_title: A 100 g ball is coming towards a bat with a velocity of 10 m/s. It strikes on the bat at 60 and rebounds. If the ball remains in contact with bat for 0.1 sec then average force is
explanation_plain_text:
=

= 2cos

= = 10 N
